title: Test
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of schools, with a total of 9 data points.
Overall Number of schools has decreased over the Year.

Number of schools is roughly constant from 2010/11 to 2012/13, slightly decreasing from 2012/13 to 2014/15, slightly increasing from 2014/15 to 2015/16, and lastly roughly constant from 2015/16 to 2018/19.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2014/15 and 2015/16.
Max Number of schools about 3.13 was recorded at Year 2010/11
Min Number of schools about 2.97 was recorded at Year 2014/15
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of schools, with a total of 9 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2010/11 to 2014/15.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately constant which exists from 2017/18 to 2018/19.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2016/17 to 2017/18.
Similarly, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2015/16 to 2016/17.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2014/15 to 2015/16.
